alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued October 10 at 2:50PM ChST until October 11 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CHST WEDNESDAY FOR EAST FACING REEFS... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of 16 to 20 feet in the surf zone. Coastal inundation up to 7 feet at Rota, 5 to 7 feet at Tinian and Saipan, 2 to 3 feet at Guam. * WHERE...East reefs of Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan. * WHEN...Until 6 PM Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dangerous surf is expected across the region the rest of today and tonight. Surf may become dangerous along west reefs after midnight as Typhoon Bolaven moves further away to the northwest.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure.
